statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: It is the king's birthday before the military parade . The ministers prepared a rectangle cake of size $n \times m(1\le n, m \le 10000)$ . The king plans to cut the cake himself. But he has a strange habit of cutting cakes. Each time, he will cut the rectangle cake into two pieces, one of which should be a square cake.. Since he loves squares , he will cut the biggest square cake. He will continue to do that until all the pieces are square. Now can you tell him how many pieces he can get when he finishes.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line contains a number $T(T \leq 1000)$, the number of the testcases.

For each testcase, the first line and the only line contains two positive numbers $n , m(1\le n, m \le 10000)$.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each testcase, print a single number as the answer.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
3
4

hint:
For the first testcase you can divide the into one cake of $2\times2$ , 2 cakes of $1\times 1$
